hedline.hl1: Publicis & Hal Riney Chosen by OfficeMax

abstract.p: OfficeMax names Publicis & Hal Riney to handle its national advertising account; billings estimated at $45 million (S)

block.p: OfficeMax, the third-largest United States office supply chain, said yesterday that it had chosen Publicis & Hal Riney in Chicago, part of Publicis S.A., to handle its national account. The account will include television, print and point-of-purchase advertising as well as special project advertising for the OfficeMax.com Web site.

OfficeMax, the third-largest United States office supply chain, said yesterday that it had chosen Publicis & Hal Riney in Chicago, part of Publicis S.A., to handle its national account. The account will include television, print and point-of-purchase advertising as well as special project advertising for the OfficeMax.com Web site.

Steve Baisden, a spokesman for OfficeMax in Shaker Heights, Ohio, said the decision came after a seven-month review that had been narrowed to Publicis and four other agencies that he declined to identify.
Office Max and Campbell-Ewald in Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, parted ways in January after a five-year relationship.
OfficeMax is conducting a separate review for the OfficeMax.com account, with billings estimated at $15 million.
